summary: Retired Air Traffic Controller with 32+ years of experience in the En Route environment. Experienced in ERAM modernization as SME and IOA team member, cross-border operations, training, and sector realignments, with strong knowledge of ATC automation, procedures, and risk management.

experience.title: Air Traffic Controller
experience.description: Maintained safe, orderly, and expeditious flow of air traffic in the NAS in the En Route environment; expert in multiple ATC disciplines; ensured adherence to FAA procedures; conducted cross-border operations; coordinated handoffs; supported Seattle area traffic at SEA; transitioned traffic between terminal and en route environments; involved in radar and non-radar operations, and applied wake turbulence procedures.

experience.title: ERAM Subject Matter Expert (SME)
experience.description: National ERAM SME responsible for identifying and documenting ERAM anomalies; provided recommendations for adaptations to improve facility performance; conducted controller training on ERAM functionality; maintained currency through collateral duties and OJT.

experience.title: National SME – Independent Operational Assessment (IOA) Team Member
experience.description: As a National SME, collected data and collaborated on the final report concerning operational readiness for ERAM’s National Deployment.

education.degree: Associate of Applied Science, Manufacturing Engineering

certifications: Certified Professional Controller (CPC), Area C – Seattle ARTCC, November 1986
